tit.e: Shoen Seiri-rei (order given to consolidate manors)
Shoen Seiri-rei (orders given to consolidate manors)
Shoen Seiri-rei (orders given to consolidate manors)

sen.j: 荘園整理令（しょうえんせいりれい）は、平安時代に発布された一連の法令のこと。
sen.e: "Shoen Seiri-rei" is a set of acts issued in the Heian period.
Shoen Seiri-rei is a set of acts issued during the Heian period.
Shoen Seiri-rei is a set of acts issued during the Heian period.

sen.j: 特に有名なのが、1069年（治暦5年 延久元年)に後三条天皇が全国の荘園を一斉整理する目的で発令した延久の荘園整理令であるが、実はこれを遡る事150年前の醍醐天皇の時代から天皇の代替わりごとに度々発令されている。
sen.e: Most renowned is the Enkyu-no Shoen Seiri-rei (an order given in the Enkyu era to consolidate manors) issued in 1069 by Emperor Gosanjo in order to consolidate manors all together nationwide, but since the days of Emperor Godaigo, 150 years prior to this, it has been issued every time the Emperor changed.

Most renowned is the Enkyu-no Shoen Seiri-rei (an order given in the Enkyu era to consolidate manors) issued in 1069 by Emperor Gosanjo to consolidate all manors together nationwide, but from the days of Emperor Godaigo, 150 years prior to this, it had been issued every time the Emperor changed.
sen.cmt: "in order" deleted, "manors all together nationwide" changed to "all manors together nationwide," "since" change to "from," "has" changed to "had"
sen.e: Most renowned is the Enkyu-no Shoen Seiri-rei (an order given in the Enkyu era to consolidate manors) issued in 1069 by Emperor Gosanjo to consolidate all manors together nationwide, but from the days of Emperor Daigo, 150 years prior to this, it had been issued every time the Emperor changed.

sen.j: 荘園の増大は摂関家などの有力貴族や彼らに保護された寺社などに莫大な収入をもたらす一方、国司等による税の徴収が不可能（すなわち公領の減少）となってしまうために国家財政に深刻な打撃を与えていた。
sen.e: Increase in manors brought enormous income to powerful nobles such as sekkan-ke (regent family), as well as temples and shrines protected by them, but on the other hand, tax collection by kokushi (provincial governors) became impossible (in other words, imperial demesne decreased), causing serious damage to national finance.

An increase in the number of manors brought enormous income to powerful nobles such as sekkan-ke (regent family), as well as temples and shrines under their protection, but on the other hand, tax collection by kokushi (provincial governors) became impossible (in other words, imperial demesne decreased), causing serious harm to national finance.
sen.cmt: corrected to "shrines under their protection," "damage" changed to "harm"
sen.e: An increase in the number of manors brought enormous income to powerful nobles such as sekkan-ke (regent family), as well as temples and shrines under their protection, but on the other hand, tax collection by kokushi (provincial governors) became impossible (in other words, imperial demesne decreased), causing serious harm to national finance.

sen.j: そのため、荘園の新規設置を取り締まり、違法性のある荘園を停止させる事で、公領を回復させて国家財政の再建を目指したものである。
sen.e: Thus, its aim was to recover imperial demesne and regenerate national finance by regulating new establishment of manors and suspending illegal manors.
Thus, the purpose was to recover imperial demesne and regenerate national financing by regulating the establishment of new manors and suspending illegal ones.
sen.cmt: wording rearranged and re-written to make it easier to read and understand
sen.e: Thus, the purpose was to recover imperial demesne and regenerate national financing by regulating the establishment of new manors and suspending illegal ones.

sen.j: だが、実際の政務を行っているのが最大の荘園領主である摂関家以下有力貴族であったこと、国司側も任期が終了に近づくと次の役職を得るための一種の猟官運動として有力貴族による荘園実施を認める傾向にあったために多くの例外が生まれ、実効性が乏しかった。
sen.e: However, since actual government affairs were performed by sekkan-ke and powerful nobles who were the most powerful manor lords, and kokushi, towards the end of their term, also had a tendency to approve manors by powerful nobles as a form of office-seeking activity to get the next post, it was not very effective.

However, since actual government affairs were performed by sekkan-ke and powerful nobles who were also the most powerful manor lords, and kokushi, towards the end of their term, who had a tendency to approve manors by powerful nobles as a form of office-seeking activity to secure their next post, it was not very effective.
sen.cmt: "also" inserted before "the most powerful," "also" deleted after "who," changed to "to secure their next post," replaces "get"
sen.e: However, since actual government affairs were performed by sekkan-ke and powerful nobles who were also the most powerful manor lords, and kokushi, towards the end of their term, who had a tendency to approve manors by powerful nobles as a form of office-seeking activity to secure their next post, it was not very effective with many exceptional cases.

sen.j: そこで「延久の荘園整理令」では従来の荘園整理令よりも強固に実行するためにそれまで地方諸国の国司達に依存していた職務を全て中央で行うようにした。
sen.e: Therefore, in the 'Enkyu-no Shoen Seiri-rei,' for a more solid execution compared to traditional Shoen Seiri-rei, all duties that depended on the kokushi in provinces were performed centrally.
Therefore, in the 'Enkyu-no Shoen Seiri-rei,' for a more solid execution compared to traditional Shoen Seiri-rei, all duties that depended upon the kokushi in provinces were performed centrally.
Therefore, in the 'Enkyu-no Shoen Seiri-rei,' for a more solid execution compared to traditional Shoen Seiri-rei, all duties that depended upon the kokushi in provinces were performed centrally.

sen.j: また、登録抹消の対象となる荘園を摂関家領にまで拡大したところに特徴がある。
sen.e: Additionally, it is distinctive in that it extended the target manors for deregistration to territories of sekkan-ke.
Additionally, it is noteworthy that the target manors for deregistration were extended to the territories of sekkan-ke.
sen.cmt: words changed and sentence restructured for clarity and easy readability
sen.e: Additionally, it is noteworthy that the target manors for deregistration were extended to the territories of sekkan-ke.

sen.j: 更に従来の命令とは違って細かい規制が加えられた。
sen.e: Furthermore, unlike traditional orders, detailed regulations were added.
Furthermore, unlike traditional orders, detailed regulations were added.
Furthermore, unlike traditional orders, detailed regulations were added.

sen.j: 劣悪な荘田と肥沃な公田を無断で交換してはならない。
sen.e: Fields within manors that are low in quality cannot be exchanged without notice with fertile fields administered directly by a ruler.
Fields within manors that were low quality could not be exchanged, without notice, for fertile fields administered directly by a ruler.
sen.cmt: words changed, removed, tense corrected, sentence restructured for clarity and readability
sen.e: Fields within manors that were low quality could not be exchanged, without notice, for fertile fields administered directly by a ruler.

sen.j: 荘園の住民が荘園外で耕している公田を荘園に含めてはならない。
sen.e: Fields administered directly by a ruler, which the resident of the manor is cultivating outside the manor, cannot be included in the manor.
Fields administered directly by a ruler, where the resident of the manor is cultivating outside the manor, cannot be included in a manor.
sen.cmt: words changed and sentence restructured for clarity and easy readability
sen.e: Fields administered directly by a ruler, where the resident of the manor is cultivating outside the manor, cannot be included in a manor.

sen.j: 国司が経費の財源として寺社等に宛がっている公田を勝手に荘園（無定坪付庄）として扱ってはならない。
sen.e: Fields administered directly by a ruler, which the kokushi allocates to temples and shrines as financial sources for costs, cannot be treated as manors (mutei-tsubotsukisho) without permission.

Fields administered directly by a ruler, that kokushi allocate, at cost, to temples and shrines considered to be financial sources, cannot be treated as manors (muteitsubotsukisho) without permission.
sen.cmt: "which" replaced with "that" It is not clear what is meant by "financial sources for costs" means and clarification is needed here. Therefore, I took a guess and restructured the sentence.
sen.e: Fields administered directly by a ruler that kokushi allocate to temples or shrines as a means of generating a source of revenue to defray expenses cannot be treated as manors (muteitsubotsukisho) without permission.
sen.cmt: 「経費の財源として」を "as a means of generating a source of revenue to defray expenses" と訳出しました。

sen.j: この時の整理令は摂関家内部の確執による対応の乱れもあって、比較的成果を収めたとされている。
sen.e: Seiri-rei in those times are said to have relatively had accomplishments, partly because of the disorder in response due to feud within the sekkan-ke.
Seiri-rei in those times are said to have relatively had accomplishments, partly because of the disorder in response due to feud within the sekkan-ke.

sen.j: だが、院政が始まると朝廷の実質的頂点である太上天皇に荘園が集中するようになり、白河天皇や鳥羽天皇も規制に乗り出すものの、この矛盾によって荘園整理政策は破綻してしまうのである。
sen.e: However, when insei (rule by retired Emperor) began, manors concentrated around the retired Emperor, who was virtually at the top in the Imperial court, and despite regulation efforts by Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Toba, such contradiction caused the manor consolidation agenda to fail.

However, when insei (rule by a retired Emperor) began, manors concentrated around a retired Emperor, who was virtually at the top of the Imperial court, for example, despite efforts at regulation by Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Toba, such a contradiction caused the manor consolidation agenda to fail.
sen.cmt: sentence restructured for clarity, "for example" inserted
sen.e: However, when insei (rule by a retired emperor) began, manors concentrated around the retired emperor, who was virtually at the top of the Imperial court; for example, despite efforts at regulation by Emperor Shirakawa and Emperor Toba, such a contradiction caused the manor consolidation agenda to fail.
